oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Tree of Life" quilt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Tree of Life" or pieced basket quilt made with approximately 1850s fabrics. The quilt belonged to Martha L. Storment (born about 1822 in South Carolina), wife of William Storment (February 10, 1811-September 15, 1885)" According to family lore, the quilt was stored in the floor of a smokehouse to protect it from the invading army when Federal troops came through Tishomingo County, Mississippi, in 1862.
